We once used to think of the establishment as being cabinet ministers, archbishops, BBC panjandrums, leaders of industry and royalty. No longer. X FACTOR boss Simon Cowell is trying to entice Britain's top voiceover man to America. Booming Peter Dickson, 49, is familiar to millions of fans for telling nervous contestants: It's time... to face... the music! Now Simon Cowell wants him to deliver his sound on the talent show's American version from the autumn. Peter, who also does Britain's Got Talent, Family Fortunes, The Paul O'Grady Show,

Google has shocked it's shareholders by announcing that Eric Schmidt , it's current CEO will step down in April and co-founder Larry Page replace him in the Chief Executive Officer role. When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined, even in my wildest dreams, that we would get as far, as fast as we have today , starts Eric Schmidt in a blog post on the company's blog while meanwhile posting on Twitter that the move was all about no longer needing to supervise founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin :`` Day-to-day adult supervision

Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
